emissions.closest_match_explanation: The ingredient '1 onion' is best matched with 'onion, raw' because it is the least processed option available, aligning with rule 4 which prioritizes less processed options when no specific processing is mentioned.

The ingredient '3 cloves of garlic' is best matched with 'garlic, raw' because it is the least processed option available, aligning with rule 4 which prioritizes less processed options when no specific processing is mentioned.

The ingredient '400 g risotto rice' is a type of rice. 'rice groats, raw' is the most appropriate match as it represents a raw, unprocessed form of rice, aligning with rule 4 which prioritizes less processed options when no specific processing is mentioned.
The ingredient '2 dl white wine' is directly matched with 'wine, white, average values' as it is the most general and representative option for white wine, aligning with rule 4.

The ingredient '400 g of ripped tomatoes' is best matched with 'tomato, ripe, raw, origin unknown' because 'ripped' implies a raw, unprocessed state, aligning with rule 4 which prioritizes less processed options when no specific processing is mentioned.
The ingredient '25 g tomato puree' is best matched with 'tomato paste, concentrated' as puree is a concentrated form of tomato, aligning with rule 4 which considers the amount of processing.

The ingredient '9 dl vegetable broth' is a prepared liquid. 'bouillon, chicken, prepared' and 'bouillon, beef, prepared' are both prepared bouillons. Since vegetable broth is not explicitly listed, and chicken bouillon is a common and generally lower-emission prepared broth compared to beef, it is chosen as the closest match based on rule 1 (realistic comparison) and rule 5 (highest emission factor if similar processing, but here chicken is chosen as a more general 'prepared broth' option when vegetable is not available).

The ingredient '25 g sun -dried tomatoes in oil' is best matched with 'sundried tomatoes' because it directly specifies 'sun-dried tomatoes'. The 'in oil' part is a preparation method that doesn't change the core ingredient's processing, aligning with rule 4.
The ingredient '125 g parmesan' is directly matched with 'cheese, hard, parmesan, 32 % fidm.' as it is an exact match for the type of cheese, aligning with rule 8.

The ingredient '0.5 ECO Lemon' is best matched with 'lemon, raw' as it is the most direct and unprocessed form of lemon available, aligning with rule 4 which prioritizes less processed options when no specific processing is mentioned.
The ingredient '1 tablespoon olive oil' is directly matched with 'olive oil' as it is an exact match, aligning with rule 8.
The ingredient 'Black pepper' is directly matched with 'pepper, black' as it is an exact match, aligning with rule 8.

The ingredient '1 burrata' is a type of fresh cheese. Among the available options, 'blue cheese', 'goat cheese', and 'mozarella sticks' are all types of cheese. 'Mozarella sticks' is a processed product, and burrata is a fresh cheese, not a blue or goat cheese. Therefore, 'blue cheese' is chosen as the closest general cheese category, aligning with rule 2 (broader category) and rule 5 (highest emission factor if similar processing levels).
The ingredient '25 g pesto' is directly matched with 'pesto' as it is an exact match, aligning with rule 8.
The ingredient '25 g parmesan' is directly matched with 'cheese, hard, parmesan, 32 % fidm.' as it is an exact match for the type of cheese, aligning with rule 8.

The ingredient '0.5 Handful of basil' is best matched with 'basil, fresh' because 'handful' implies a fresh, unprocessed state, aligning with rule 4 which prioritizes less processed options when no specific processing is mentioned.
